Summary : This image provides a detailed description of the Verus Opinion stock rating system, including its methodology, coverage statistics, and current distribution of ratings, accompanied by a visual indicator and the Verus Analytics logo. infographic: # Visual Elements : • A vertical bar with three segments: green (top), tan (middle), and red (bottom). • A black arrow labeled "Hold" pointing to the tan (middle) segment. • The Verus Analytics logo appears at the bottom right. # Verus Opinion System Description : • The Verus Opinion is an empirically-derived, historically back-tested stock rating system with buy, hold, and sell opinions. • The system analyzes company earnings quality, balance sheet, income statement, technical and valuation analysis, and insider transactions. • Ratings are based on a quantitative system. # Coverage and Rating Distribution : • As of 2025-07-04, the Verus Opinion covers 4,359 companies. • 19.8% are rated Buy. • 64.2% are rated Hold. • 16.0% are rated Sell. # Company and Independence : • Verus Analytics Inc is a private, independent research firm. • The firm is unaffiliated with Refinitiv and specializes in engineering institutional ratings systems. # Design Encodings : • The green, tan, and red bar visually represents Buy, Hold, and Sell ratings, respectively. • The black arrow and bold "Hold" text highlight the current rating. • The Verus Analytics logo uses black and orange text. # Analysis : • The majority of companies (64.2%) are rated Hold, with fewer rated Buy (19.8%) or Sell (16.0%). • The visual bar and arrow emphasize the Hold rating as the current recommendation. • The layout combines textual explanation with visual cues for clarity. Summary : This figure presents the consensus analyst recommendation for a company, as aggregated from 53 analysts, using a standardized 5-point scale ranging from "Strong Sell" to "Strong Buy." The mean recommendation is "Buy," and the distribution of individual analyst ratings is shown. bar chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "I/B/E/S MEAN" • No explicit X or Y axis labels; horizontal bars represent the number of analysts for each recommendation category. • Categories (from top to bottom): Strong Buy, Buy, Hold, Sell, Strong Sell. • Numeric values shown at the end of each bar: 11 (Strong Buy), 26 (Buy), 15 (Hold), 0 (Sell), 1 (Strong Sell). Data Points : • Strong Buy: 11 analysts • Buy: 26 analysts • Hold: 15 analysts • Sell: 0 analysts • Strong Sell: 1 analyst Design Encodings : • Green bars for positive recommendations (Strong Buy, Buy). • Grey bar for neutral recommendation (Hold). • Red bars for negative recommendations (Sell, Strong Sell). • Numeric values displayed at the end of each bar. • A horizontal scale at the bottom visually segments the 5-point scale, with a black arrow indicating the mean recommendation at "Buy." Distribution & Trends : • The majority of analysts (26) rate the stock as "Buy." • The next largest group is "Hold" (15 analysts). • "Strong Buy" is selected by 11 analysts. • Only 1 analyst rates it as "Strong Sell," and none rate it as "Sell." Analysis : • The consensus recommendation is "Buy," with most analysts clustered in the "Buy" and "Hold" categories. • Very few analysts have negative recommendations, and almost none rate it as "Sell" or "Strong Sell." • The mean recommendation is visually indicated to be solidly in the "Buy" range, reflecting overall positive sentiment among analysts. Summary : This figure presents two price and volume charts for a financial instrument, showing its performance over 1-year and 5-year periods, including returns and trading volumes. line and area charts: # 1-Year Chart : • Title: "1-Year Return: -21.6%" • X-axis: Time, labeled monthly from Jul 2024 to Jun 2025. • Y-axis (left): Price, range from 80 to 180. • Volume subplot: Y-axis from 0K to 100,000K. # 5-Year Chart : • Title: "5-Year Return: 158.0%" • X-axis: Time, labeled yearly from 2020 to 2025. • Y-axis (left): Price, range from 0 to 200. • Volume subplot: Y-axis from 0K to 200,000K. # Design Encodings : • Price is shown as a filled orange area chart in both panels. • Volume is shown as vertical gray bars below each price chart. • No gridlines, but horizontal dashed lines mark price levels. # Distribution & Trends : • 1-Year: Price started near 180, declined to below 100, then partially recovered to about 140 by June 2025. • 5-Year: Price rose from below 100 in 2020 to peaks above 200, with notable volatility and several peaks and troughs. • Volume: Fluctuates throughout, with no clear long-term trend visible. # Analysis : • Over the past year, the instrument experienced a significant decline (-21.6%), with a partial recovery in the last months. • Over five years, the instrument achieved a strong cumulative return (158.0%), despite periods of high volatility. • Volume does not show a clear correlation with price movements in the visible data. BUSINESS SUMMARY Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. is a global semiconductor company. It is focused on high-performance computing, graphics and visualization technologies. It operates in four segments. The Data Center segment includes artificial intelligence (AI) accelerators, server central processing units (CPUs), graphics processing units (GPUs), accelerated processing units (APUs), data processing units (DPUs), field programmable gate arrays (FPGAs), smart network interface cards (SmartNICs), and Adaptive system-on-chip (SoC) products for data centers. The Client segment primarily includes CPUs, APUs, and chipsets for desktops and notebooks. The Gaming segment primarily includes discrete GPUs, semi-custom SoC products and development services. The Embedded segment includes embedded CPUs, GPUs, APUs, FPGAs, system on modules (SOMs), and Adaptive SoC products. It markets and sells its products under the AMD trademark. Its products include AMD EPYC, AMD Ryzen, AMD Ryzen PRO, Virtex UltraScale+ and others. Summary : This figure presents analysts' 12-month price target predictions for a stock, comparing the current price to projected high, mean, and low targets, and summarizing the consensus among 41 analysts. line and table combination: Title & Axes : • Title: "PRICE TARGET" • X-axis: "Current Price (USD)" and "Price Target" • Y-axis: Price in USD, range shown from 90.00 to 240.00 • Key data point: Current Price = 144.16 USD Data Points : • 12-Month Price Target (mean): 137.00 USD • High target: 200.00 USD • Low target: 95.00 USD • Target vs. Current: -5.0% • Number of analysts: 41 Design Encodings : • Orange lines connect the current price to high, mean, and low price targets, forming a triangle. • Dots mark the high, mean, and low price targets on the right, and the current price on the left. • Shaded orange area between the lines. • Table on the right summarizes numeric values. Distribution & Trends : • The mean price target (137.00 USD) is lower than the current price (144.16 USD). • The high target (200.00 USD) is substantially above the current price, while the low target (95.00 USD) is well below. • The consensus target is 5% below the current price. Analysis : • Most analysts expect the stock price to decrease slightly over the next 12 months, with a mean target 5% below the current price. • There is a wide range of opinions, as indicated by the high (200.00 USD) and low (95.00 USD) targets. • The majority view (mean) is slightly bearish, but the spread suggests significant uncertainty or differing outlooks among analysts. Summary : This figure presents actual and estimated earnings per share (EPS) for a company, both quarterly and annually, including high, mean, and low analyst forecasts, with supporting definitions and tabular data. line chart: Title & Axes : • No explicit chart title; context is "Earnings Per Share". • Top chart: X-axis shows quarterly periods (24-06, 24-09, 24-12, 25-03, 25-06, 25-09); Y-axis ranges from 0.4 to 1.4 (units: USD). • Bottom chart: X-axis shows annual periods (2023, 2024, 2025, 2026); Y-axis ranges from 2.00 to 12.00 (units: USD). LSEG Stock Reports Plus ADVANCED MICRO DEVICES INC (AMD-O) Technology Equipment / Semiconductors & Equipment / Semiconductors COMPANY IN CONTEXT REPORT Report Date: 2025-Jul-11 - Compared to the Semiconductors industry, AMD is currently trading at a significant premium based on both Trailing P/E and Forward PEG. - Based on Trailing P/E, AMD currently trades at a 86% Premium to its Semiconductors industry peers. On average, the company has traded at a >100% Premium over the past five years. - Based on Forward PEG, AMD currently trades at a 21% Premium to its Semiconductors industry peers. On average, the company has traded at a 16% Discount over the past five years. - AMD's Forward P/E of 35.6 represents a 0.5% Premium to its 5-year average of 35.4. Summary : This figure presents the trailing price-to-earnings (PE) ratio over time, comparing the most recent value to historical averages and benchmarks. line chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "TRAILING PE" • X-axis: Years (2020 to 2025, labeled at yearly intervals) • Y-axis: Trailing PE ratio (0 to >50, labeled at intervals of 5 up to 50, with a line at >50) • Additional text: "The most recent week's close price divided by the sum of the four most recently reported quarterly earnings." Data Points : • Single series (orange line): Trailing PE ratio from 2020 to 2025. • Notable values: – Trailing PE (most recent): 106.0 – 5-Year Average: 74.6 – S&P 500 Index Average: 29.6 – Industry Average: 57.1 • The plotted line fluctuates between approximately 25 and 45 from 2020 to early 2022, then rises sharply and remains at the >50 threshold from mid-2022 onward. Design Encodings : • Orange line for the PE ratio. • Horizontal red line at the >50 mark, indicating values above the chart's Y-axis maximum. • No markers, error bars, or confidence bands. Distribution & Trends : • The PE ratio shows moderate fluctuations between 25 and 45 from 2020 to early 2022. • There is a sharp increase in mid-2022, after which the PE ratio remains above 50 (off the visible Y-axis scale) through to 2025. Analysis : • The trailing PE ratio is currently much higher (106.0) than its 5-year average (74.6), the S&P 500 Index average (29.6), and the industry average (57.1). • The data shows a period of volatility followed by a sustained, extreme elevation in the PE ratio from mid-2022 onward, suggesting a significant change in valuation or earnings dynamics during this period. Summary : This line chart shows the Forward Price-to-Earnings (PE) ratio over time, comparing the most recent value to historical averages and benchmarks. line chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "FORWARD PE" • X-axis: Years from 2020 to 2025 (tick marks at each year). • Y-axis: Forward PE ratio, ranging from 0 to >50 (tick marks at 0, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40, 45, >50). Data Points : • Orange line: Forward PE ratio, plotted weekly from 2020 to 2025. • Dashed black line: "5-Yr Average" level, visually aligned at approximately 35 on the Y-axis. • Key values (as of the most recent week): – Forward PE: 35.6 – 5-Year Average: 35.4 – S&P 500 Index Average: 23.7 – Industry Average: 31.0 Design Encodings : • Orange solid line for Forward PE. • Black dashed horizontal line for 5-Year Average. • No markers; lines only. • No log scales or error bars. Distribution & Trends : • Forward PE ratio fluctuates between ~20 and >40 from 2020 to 2025. • Notable dips below the 5-year average in 2022 and 2024. • Peaks above the 5-year average in early 2020, late 2022, and late 2023. • Recent trend (late 2024) shows a sharp increase toward the 5-year average. Analysis : • The Forward PE ratio is currently 35.6, slightly above its 5-year average of 35.4. • The ratio is significantly higher than both the S&P 500 Index Average (23.7) and the Industry Average (31.0). • The chart reveals cyclical fluctuations, with periods both above and below the 5-year average, and a recent upward movement approaching the historical mean. Summary : This figure presents the Forward PEG ratio (Forward P/E divided by the five-year forecasted growth rate) over time, comparing the current value to historical averages, the S&P 500 Index average, and the industry average. line chart: Title & Axes : • Title: "FORWARD PEG" • X-axis: Years (2020 to 2025, labeled at yearly intervals) • Y-axis: Forward PEG ratio (range: 0.0 to 10.0, tick marks at 1.0 intervals) Data Points : • Main series (orange line): Forward PEG ratio from 2020 to 2025, showing values generally between 0.5 and 2.5, with a notable spike above 4.0 in 2022–2023. • Dashed horizontal line: 5-Year Average at 1.7. Design Encodings : • Orange solid line for Forward PEG ratio. • Black dashed line for 5-Year Average. • No markers; continuous line. • No log scales or dual axes. Distribution & Trends : • The Forward PEG ratio remains below the 5-Year Average for most of 2020–2021. • There is a sharp increase in the Forward PEG ratio in 2022, peaking above 4.0, followed by a decline back toward the average. • The ratio stabilizes near 1.3 by 2024–2025. Reference Values (from annotation) : • Forward PEG: 1.3 • 5-Year Average: 1.7 • S&P 500 Index Average: 1.9 • Industry Average: 1.1 Analysis : • The Forward PEG ratio experienced a significant spike in 2022–2023, rising well above its 5-year average, before returning to a level (1.3) below both the 5-year and S&P 500 Index averages but slightly above the industry average. The current value suggests a lower valuation relative to growth expectations compared to recent history and the broader market. - On days when the market is up, AMD shares tends to outperform the S&P 500 index. However, on days when the market is down, the shares generally decrease by more than the index. - In both short-term and long-term periods, AMD has shown high correlation (>= 0.4) with the S&P 500 index. Thus, this stock would provide only low levels of diversification to a portfolio similar to the broader market. - Over the last 90 days, AMD shares have been more volatile than the overall market, as the stock's daily price fluctuations have exceeded that of 93% of S&P 500 index firms. The report is updated daily, although the ratings are updated weekly. - **Peer Analysis** - • The Peer Analysis section of the report compares the company to up to ten of its closest peers. The peers are selected based on competitors data from the company's annual reports, the number of cross-over analysts with recommendations on both companies, and the same industry classifications. - • The Reference data Business Classification (TRBC) schema is used for industry comparisons. It is designed to group together correlated companies that offer products and services into similar end markets. **Highlights** The automated text-generation system from LSEG creates highlights summarizing the most noteworthy data. The bullets will vary by company and will change from week to week as different criteria are met. Earnings Earnings Per Share The quarterly and annual earnings per share are presented when available, along with the mean, high and low. Quarterly data is displayed for the past 4 quarters (actual) and the next 2 quarters (estimated). Annual data is displayed for the past 2 years (actual) and the next 2 years (estimated). Mean Estimate Trend The mean estimates show how the consensus has changed over the past 30 days and 90 days for the upcoming two quarters and two years. The percentage change is calculated for the company as a means for comparison by measuring the difference between the current consensus estimate and that of 90 days ago. Earnings Surprises The surprise summary includes the total number of quarters (and percentage) in the past 12 quarters in which earnings surprises were positive, negative, or in-line. In order to be recognized as a positive or negative surprise, the percent must be greater than 2% above or 2% below the consensus, respectively. - **Fundamental** - **Profitability** - • Revenue Growth: (Net Sales - Previous Net Sales) / Previous Net Sales - • Gross Margin: Gross Profit / Net Sales - • Return on Equity: Net Income / Total Equity - • Net Margin: Net Profit / Net Sales - **Debt** - • Current Ratio: Current Assets / Current Liabilities - • Debt-to-Capital: Total Debt / Total Capital - • Interest Funding: Interest Expense / Operating Cash Flow - • Interest Coverage: (Pre-Tax Income + Interest Expense) / Interest Expense - **Dividend** - • Dividend Growth Rate: (Dividends per Share - Previous Dividends per Share) / Previous Dividends per Share - • Dividend Funding: Dividends / Operating Cash Flow - • Dividend Coverage: (Pre-Tax Income + Interest Expense) / (Interest Expense + Dividends) - • Dividend Yield: Annual Dividends per Share / Current Market Price per Share Relative Valuation A discount occurs when the company's ratio is valued more favorably (lower) than that to which it is compared. Valuation Averages Negative values are excluded when calculating the averages. A maximum value of 100 is placed on Trailing P/E and Forward P/E, and a maximum value of 5 is placed on Forward PEG when calculating the averages. Risk Magnitude of Returns The best / worst daily returns in the past 90 days and the best / worst monthly returns in the past 60 months. **Volatility** The standard deviation of the stock price over the last 90 days and last 60 months, along with the average and largest intra-day stock swing. Beta Measures the tendency of a security's returns to respond to swings in the market, based on the beta of the company versus the relevant index. Correlation Determines how closely the returns of the stock and the relevant index move together, measured over the last 90 days and last 60 months. Price Momentum Relative Strength Measures the speed and change of price movements. A value above 70 may be overbought while a value below 30 may be oversold. Seasonality The average monthly return for the current month and next 2 months for the company and industry, over the past 10 years. A lower industry rank indicates a higher return. Insider Trading Monthly Buys and Sells The total market value of open-market buying and selling is displayed by month for easy comparison. Transactions by trusts and corporations are excluded, along with buys greater than $10 million and sales greater than $50 million. **Institutional Holders** The top five institutional holders of the company are listed in descending order, based on their total share holdings. Executive Holders The top five executive insiders of the company are listed in descending order, based on their total direct common share holdings (options are not considered). Indirect holdings are excluded, as the owner may not actually have investment discretion over these shares. Insiders who have not filed any transactions or holdings over the past two years are excluded, as the individual may no longer be associated with the company.   • The Verus Opinion is an empirically-derived, historically back-tested stock rating system with buy, hold, and sell opinions.

  • 64.2% are rated Hold.

  • The green, tan, and red bar visually represents Buy, Hold, and Sell ratings, respectively.
  • The black arrow and bold "Hold" text highlight the current rating.

  • The layout combines textual explanation with visual cues for clarity.

  • Volume does not show a clear correlation with price movements in the visible data.

BUSINESS SUMMARY
Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. is a global semiconductor company. It is focused on high-performance computing, graphics and visualization technologies. It operates in four segments. The Data Center segment includes artificial intelligence (AI) accelerators, server central processing units (CPUs), graphics processing units (GPUs), accelerated processing units (APUs), data processing units (DPUs), field programmable gate arrays (FPGAs), smart network interface cards (SmartNICs), and Adaptive system-on-chip (SoC) products for data centers. The Client segment primarily includes CPUs, APUs, and chipsets for desktops and notebooks. The Gaming segment primarily includes discrete GPUs, semi-custom SoC products and development services. The Embedded segment includes embedded CPUs, GPUs, APUs, FPGAs, system on modules (SOMs), and Adaptive SoC products. It markets and sells its products under the AMD trademark. Its products include AMD EPYC, AMD Ryzen, AMD Ryzen PRO, Virtex UltraScale+ and others.

REPORT TIPS
The Company in Context Report provides a comprehensive company analysis based on market data from LSEG and a proprietary rating from Verus Analytics. The report is updated daily, although the ratings are updated weekly.

- **Peer Analysis**
- • The Peer Analysis section of the report compares the company to up to ten of its closest peers. The peers are selected based on competitors data from the company's annual reports, the number of cross-over analysts with recommendations on both companies, and the same industry classifications.
- • The Reference data Business Classification (TRBC) schema is used for industry comparisons. It is designed to group together correlated companies that offer products and services into similar end markets.

**Highlights**  
The automated text-generation system from LSEG creates highlights summarizing the most noteworthy data. The bullets will vary by company and will change from week to week as different criteria are met.

Earnings  
Earnings Per Share  
The quarterly and annual earnings per share are presented when available, along with the mean, high and low. Quarterly data is displayed for the past 4 quarters (actual) and the next 2 quarters (estimated). Annual data is displayed for the past 2 years (actual) and the next 2 years (estimated).

Mean Estimate Trend  
The mean estimates show how the consensus has changed over the past 30 days and 90 days for the upcoming two quarters and two years. The percentage change is calculated for the company as a means for comparison by measuring the difference between the current consensus estimate and that of 90 days ago.

Earnings Surprises
The surprise summary includes the total number of quarters (and percentage) in the past 12 quarters in which earnings surprises were positive, negative, or in-line. In order to be recognized as a positive or negative surprise, the percent must be greater than 2% above or 2% below the consensus, respectively.

- **Fundamental**
- **Profitability**
  - • Revenue Growth: (Net Sales - Previous Net Sales) / Previous Net Sales
  - • Gross Margin: Gross Profit / Net Sales
  - • Return on Equity: Net Income / Total Equity
  - • Net Margin: Net Profit / Net Sales

- **Debt**
  - • Current Ratio: Current Assets / Current Liabilities
  - • Debt-to-Capital: Total Debt / Total Capital
  - • Interest Funding: Interest Expense / Operating Cash Flow
  - • Interest Coverage: (Pre-Tax Income + Interest Expense) / Interest Expense

- **Dividend**
  - • Dividend Growth Rate: (Dividends per Share - Previous Dividends per Share) / Previous Dividends per Share
  - • Dividend Funding: Dividends / Operating Cash Flow
  - • Dividend Coverage: (Pre-Tax Income + Interest Expense) / (Interest Expense + Dividends)
  - • Dividend Yield: Annual Dividends per Share / Current Market Price per Share

Relative Valuation  
A discount occurs when the company's ratio is valued more favorably (lower) than that to which it is compared.

Valuation Averages  
Negative values are excluded when calculating the averages. A maximum value of 100 is placed on Trailing P/E and Forward P/E, and a maximum value of 5 is placed on Forward PEG when calculating the averages.

Risk  
Magnitude of Returns  
The best / worst daily returns in the past 90 days and the best / worst monthly returns in the past 60 months.

**Volatility**  
The standard deviation of the stock price over the last 90 days and last 60 months, along with the average and largest intra-day stock swing.

Beta
Measures the tendency of a security's returns to respond to swings in the market, based on the beta of the company versus the relevant index.

Correlation  
Determines how closely the returns of the stock and the relevant index move together, measured over the last 90 days and last 60 months.

Price Momentum  
Relative Strength  
Measures the speed and change of price movements. A value above 70 may be overbought while a value below 30 may be oversold.

Seasonality  
The average monthly return for the current month and next 2 months for the company and industry, over the past 10 years. A lower industry rank indicates a higher return.

Insider Trading
Monthly Buys and Sells
The total market value of open-market buying and selling is displayed by month for easy comparison. Transactions by trusts and corporations are excluded, along with buys greater than $10 million and sales greater than $50 million.

**Institutional Holders**  
The top five institutional holders of the company are listed in descending order, based on their total share holdings. Possible values for the institution type include Brokerage, Funds, Inv Mgmt, or Strategic.

Executive Holders

VERUS ANALYTICS

Verus Analytics, Inc is a private firm specializing in engineering rating systems for institutional clients, wealth managers and self-directed investors. They also provide proprietary ratings of earnings quality, fundamental and valuation elements directly to institutional clients. Verus Analytics (previously Camelback Research Alliance, Inc and the quantitative business unit of Gradient Analytics, Inc) was founded in 1996 by two former tenured professors, Dr. Carr Bettis and Dr. Donn Vickrey. Today the core team consists of financial engineers, business analysts and technology personnel. Verus Analytics does not engage in investment banking services.
